segments.text: So how ’ s everything going for Christmas ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I ’ Ve got all the presents I need , and my family is working together to get all the food ready . That ’ s easy ; but I have another problem to deal with .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What ’ s that ? Don ’ t tell me you ’ Ve still got Christmas cards to write , it usually takes my wife a month to write all of ours .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No , I did that a long time ago . It ’ s about telling my son the truth about Santa Claus .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: He still doesn ’ t know that Santa isn ’ t real ? How old is he , eight ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes . He ’ s never said anything so I never told him . But now that he ’ s getting older ...
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You think it ’ s better that he should be told ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , he ’ s too old to believe in that type of things . And I ’ d rather tell him before the kids at school do .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That happened to my oldest girl . She became really upset when her classmates told her Santa wasn ’ t real .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I can understand . I was lucky with my oldest ; she figured it out by herself and didn ’ t tell my son .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , when you tell him , be gentle . It ’ s hard for kids to find out something like that .
segments.speaker: S1
